artist: Artist: Utagawa Kuniyoshi; Publisher: Kawaguchiya Chōzō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: right sheet of a diptych; seated man wearing a blue loincloth and an open short kimono with pale red hexagonal designs with blue centers and black trim, looking toward PR; man holds up a fish in his PL hand and holds a knife in his PR hand, with a low pink bench before him, with orange and yellow ovoid objects; blue and white bowl in LLC; screen behind man with moon and squirrel (?)
markings: censor seal: kiwame; publisher\'s seal: Kawacho_
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: related to the play Shida yakata mitsugi no funauta 信田館貢物船諷, Ichimura Theater, IX/1832
title: Actor Sawamura Tosshō I as Shida Hayato
